FuncDef:
The member-slot multicast command specifies the slot IDs of boards on which specified global VE members reside for multicast traffic.
The undo member-slot multicast command cancels the slot IDs of boards on which specified global VE members reside for multicast traffic.
By default, global VE member interfaces are added to all boards on a device for multicast traffic.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start slot ID of a board.
-

Specifies the end slot ID of a board.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a VE-Group is bound to a multicast service, all interface boards in the VE-Group are member interface boards by default. When Layer 3 multicast traffic leaves an L3VE interface and enters an L2VE interface, the upstream interface board detects that the multicast outbound interface of the multicast traffic is the VE-Group and copies the traffic to all member interface boards. The interface boards then prune the traffic in the downstream direction. After a global VE interface is configured, you need to specify the range of interface boards to be added to the global VE interface. You can run the member-slot multicast command to reduce the number of interface boards to be added to the VE-Group, reducing the number of copies of multicast traffic.
Prerequisites
A global VE interface has been created and the binding type is L2VE.
Precautions
This command applies only to the Admin-VS.
